definition: to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: I can't get a dial tone.
Did you hear a dial tone?
We're losing the dial tone, too.
sentences.chinese: 我們也快聽不到電話的撥號音了。

sentences.english: The phone must be out of order if you can’t hear a dial tone.
sentences.chinese: 如果聽不到撥號音，電話一定是壞了。

sentences.english: And I can't get a proper dialing tone.
sentences.chinese: 我得不到正常的撥號音。

sentences.english: When you hear the dial tone, dail the number.
sentences.chinese: 聽到撥號音後，就可以撥號碼了。

sentences.english: Yes, it's dead. There's no dial tone.
sentences.chinese: 是的，它毫無聲響，沒有撥號音。

sentences.english: The wizard could not detect a dial tone .
